content.title: Home for the Aged and Infirm
content.beneficiary: Senior Citizens above 60 years from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families
content.details: The scheme 'Home for the Aged and Infirm' was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to cater to the needs of persons who are aged/infirm, i.e. senior citizens, both male and female above the age of 60 years from Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.
benefits: In-door Entertainments Such as Television, Radio, Books Etc.
4 Sets of Clothes Are Provided to Them Every Year.
₹ 5/- is Given to Them Daily as Pocket Money.
Annual Tour to Places of Interest is Conducted for the Inmates Subject to Their Health Conditions.
Annual Day Function is Also Celebrated Without Affecting Their Health Conditions.
The Inmates Can Continue to Stay in the Home Till the End of Their Life.
The Last Rites of the Inmates Are Also Carried Out by the Government at Free of Cost.
eligibility: The applicant should have no one to look after them.
The applicant should be above 60 years of age.
The applicant should not be suffering from communicable disease or mental illness.
documents_required: Certificate issued by the Medical Superintendents (Government Hospital).
Certificate issued by the Welfare Officer of the Social Welfare Department.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the 'Home for the Aged and Infirm' scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants above 60 years from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families with no one to look after them, free from communicable diseases or mental illness.

faqs.question: What are the key benefits provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Inmates receive free food, lodging, medical facilities, 4 sets of clothes annually, ₹5 daily as pocket money, and the government conducts their last rites at no cost.

faqs.question: How long can the inmates stay in the home?
faqs.answer: Inmates can continue to stay in the home till the end of their life, ensuring a permanent and supportive environment.

faqs.question: What is the process for lodging an application?
faqs.answer: Applications are submitted to specific authorities: Field Officer in Puducherry, Assistant Director in Karaikal, and Welfare Officer in Mahe/Yanam.

faqs.question: Can applicants with communicable diseases or mental illness be admitted?
faqs.answer: No, individuals suffering from communicable diseases or mental illness are not admitted to the home.

faqs.question: What actions can be taken in case of delayed benefit disbursal?
faqs.answer: Contact the designated authorities: Director in Puducherry, Collector in Karaikal, or Regional Administrator in Mahe/Yanam.

faqs.question: Are there entertainment options provided for the inmates?
faqs.answer: Yes, in-door entertainments such as television, radio, and books are available to enhance the quality of life for the inmates.

faqs.question: What is the daily pocket money amount given to the inmates?
faqs.answer: Inmates receive ₹5 daily as pocket money, ensuring a small financial allowance for personal expenses.

faqs.question: How often are annual tours organized for the inmates?
faqs.answer: Annual tours to places of interest are conducted for the inmates, subject to their health conditions, providing recreational opportunities.

faqs.question: What documents are required for the application process?
faqs.answer: Required documents include certificates from medical superintendents, the welfare officer, Aadhaar card, voter ID, address proof, ration card, and age proof.

faqs.question: Who conducts the last rites of the inmates, and is there any cost involved?
faqs.answer: The government conducts the last rites of the inmates at no cost, ensuring a dignified and respectful end.
